relation: Drury is close to downtown Springfield so there is a lot of night life to partake in, if that's what you like. Drury is also a wet campus so there is usually a lot of parties and nights out if you want to go out.
The food is definitely the worst aspect of Drury. The commons makes the same, less than satisfying food daily. There are no outside food chains and there is only one cafe which is only semi-decent.

The dorms are quite expensive and you don't have the choice of living elsewhere. There isn't a big variety of options because there is only three dorms on the campus. They aren't the biggest or most modern dorms but they get the job done and they're close to most classes.

Drury is a very prestigious school, well known for their academic program. The courses are quite rigorous but not unbearable. The professors are very willing to help out if you are confused or fall behind.

Drury is a fantastic school. It's small high school like environment feels homey and despite the tuition rates, I would recommend it to anyone. Everyone supports everyone at Drury and it's like another family.
pageTitle: Drury University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
